programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Seam Stress. Today, Queen has decided to commission a unique dress from her talented Seamstress Card: she wants it made out of wild thread – a very difficult one to tame! And should her Seamstress Card fail to pull it off, she will be relieved of her duties on the spot! Alice and Lewis jump to it, coming up with all kinds of bright ideas to help out the poor card. As a result, in the end, a whole cat walk of dresses awaits the Queen!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Freeze-All Cutie-Twee. Alice and Lewis find the twins frozen in place! It turns out to be the doing of a young Freeze-All Cutie-Twee who has become friends with Charlie. In fact, these two besties are having the time of their lives, traveling all over the place, freezing the whole Kingdom, unaware that the young Cutie-Twee has not yet mastered its powers! Alice and Lewis must find a way to persuade Charlie to take the Cutie-Twee back to its peers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Not a Piece of Cake! When the Wonderland cuckoos realize their precious wild strawberry pies have all been picked, it’s mayhem! They go bonkers, screeching up a storm, almost deafening our poor friends. The Queen subsequently orders Alice and Lewis to put an end to this din! But the mission gets tricky when our two heroes find out who picked the pies!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Snow Queen. Alice and Lewis make a "snow-woman" in the Queen’s likeness. But, miffed at not bearing a very strong resemblance to the original, she heads off to meet her model. Our two heroes are scared: their mockery is about to be discovered! But surprise surprise!: the Queen is anything but offended! In fact, she takes the snow-woman under her wing, even going so far as to appoint her her deputy! Unfortunately for Alice and Lewis, this icy substitute becomes just as moody as the Queen: now they’re going to have to do all they can to remind her who she truly is!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: The Good the Wicked and the Silver Part 1. When they put all the clues for the silver slippers together, Dorothy and friends discover that the answer is through hole in the ground the Quox made. Taking the drill coaster down through the tunnel, they evade the Quox and end up on the bottom side of the world where the Silver Fortress awaits them. They enter the Fortress, evading traps and magical guards and making it all the way to the top of the highest tower where the silver slippers reside. But just as Dorothy can get her hands on the slippers, the Wicked Witch swipes them away, taking them for herself!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: The Good the Wicked and the Silver Part 2. The Wicked Witch has taken the silver slippers and now the entire Silver Fortress and its silver army is under her command! Dorothy and her friends escape the fortress and go back to Oz to try to warn everyone, but the Wicked Witch is right behind them, riding on the back of the Quox. The Witch tells them that Dorothy must surrender the ruby slippers to her before the silver army gets there and marches on Emerald City. But Dorothy and friends refuse to go down without a fight. And they have some volunteers to help: Baron Fernando Von Soozle, the infamous Witch Hunter, is back. But this time he's brought an entire League of Witch Hunters to help them take on the Wicked Witch. Will it be enough? Well, it'll have to do for right now.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Just for Kicks. The Wicked Witch decides she needs an army to replace the one that she lost and sets her sights on the all-female all-dancing army of General Jinjur. She lures the overworked and over-danced army of Jinjur away from her and has plans to turn their kicks destructive. Jinjur goes to Dorothy for help. They team up to create a new army to get the Witch's one away from her, but the only people they're able to recruit are Woozy and his friends. They're going to have to whip Woozy and the other animals into shape if they stand a chance of defeating the Witch's karate-kicking army.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: DOROTHY AND THE WIZARD OF OZ is an animated comedy fantasy series that transports viewers back to the wonderful land of Oz. Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale (GREY DeLISLE) has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hypnosis. Mike wakes up in the bathtub, huh? The house has been turned upside down and the other animals are being weird. They're acting like zombies and carrying food out of the house. Our pug discovers that the raccoons have hypnotised Fluffy, the turtles, and Iris, and are using them to transport the contents of the Mikkelsens fridge to their lair. Our hero will need to confront Iris to save her from the raccoon's dastardly scheme... and refill the Mikkelson's fridge!

programme.title: Mighty Mike

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: North Meets West. With the Wicked Witch becoming more of a threat, Dorothy, Glinda, and the gang go to Tattypoo, the retired Good Witch of the North to see if she'll come out of retirement to help them fight against the Wicked Witch of the West and her silver slippers. Just as Tattypoo is about to agree, the Wicked Witch strikes and erases her memory, putting her out of commission. The Wicked Witch has a plan to trick the amnesiac Tattypoo into believing that she was an evil witch just like her before she lost her memory. It's up to Dorothy and friends to retrieve enough mementos from Tattypoo's past to help her remember who she really was.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Battle for the Silver Slippers Part 1. With the Wicked Witch run amok with power, Dorothy decides that enough is enough and she's got to find a way to stop the silver slippers. She and her friends travel back to the Silver Fortress to see if it can provide any clues to the slippers' power. But the Wicked Witch knows what they're up to and is watching they're every move. When they find a mysterious door inside the fortress, the Witch traps them and opens it herself. From the other side of the door walks out someone they would never expect, the Wicked Witch of the East!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Battle for the Silver Slippers Part 2. Dorothy and the gang retreat back to Oz to inform everyone what's happened: the Wicked Witch of the East is back! When the two Wicked Witches show up in Emerald City and come after Dorothy for her ruby red slippers, everyone else is forced to retreat while Dorothy protects the slippers by herself alone in Emerald City. If the Wicked Witch of the East gets her hands on them, she'll be back for good! Glinda helps the gang recruit all their friends and the people Dorothy has helped to come to her aid and take on the two Wicked Witches as a united Ozian front. Just for long enough to get those silver slippers off the Wicked Witch of the West's feet so East gets sent back to the other side!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Blue Door Mystery. Queen is seething: her QueenMobile has broken down on the other side of Wonderland and she hasn’t found any blue doors to get her back home. So she commissions Alice and Lewis to draw up a map of all the blue doors in the Kingdom. The mission turns out to be more complicated than expected when our heroes realize the doors in question are VERY FIDGETY!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Trainee Book-Wizards. Before heading off on a trip to find new seeds, the Book-Wizard entrusts his garden to his new apprentices, Alice and Lewis. But it’s a pretty stressful experience: besides having to tend to the garden, they also have to answer the Twins when they come to ask for advice, and entertain the Queen when she decides to turn up unannounced, for teatime! And when Charlie gets whisked away by a bird-book, it’s panic-stations for the two apprentices. In fact, things get so out of hand that they have to call the Book-Wizard to the rescue!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Heel! What a disaster!: the Queen’s favorite booties have gone missing! And if Alice and Lewis don’t find them, they’re going to have to shine all fifty-thirteen other pairs of shoes in her majesty’s possession! Hot on the heels of the mischievous boots, our two heroes must use clever tactics to persuade them to get back to the Queen’s feet!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Too Young. When Alice and Lewis go to the Valley of the Night to look for MooMoo wool, they run into Queen and Charlie. When the little prince asks if he can go with the girl and her rabbit friend, the Queen begrudgingly agrees, and orders the two friends to take good care of her nephew. Charlie is ecstatic to be able to go on a “big boy’s adventure!” But is brought down to Earth with a bang when he finds out his aunt has been following them on the quiet. Feeling betrayed, he decides to run away.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Frost Ball. The King of Frostaland invites the Queen to a “frost ball” in his realm. Eager to look good, the Wonderland monarch appoints Lewis to open the ball, and threatens to remove him as clockmaster should he mess up! The poor rabbit must now set about learning the art of “tea-skating,” a kind of ice-skating on teapots! Only problem is, he’s scared of taking the plunge and decides to listen to Dodson’s advice (the dodo’s taken on the role of self-appointed coach) instead of simply trying it out himself. Needless to say, Dodson exploits the situation to get extra special treatment. So Alice steps in, determined to do whatever it takes to bring Lewis to his senses.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike Flu. Poor Mike is bedridden. He's been struck down by a nasty cold so Iris and the turtles are forced take care of his every need, including trying to repel the raccoons from the house. Fighting raccoons isn't their specialty and Iris and the turtles quickly end up locked in the garage. Mike is forced to intervene but he's so sick and weak that he's a pushover. How can he overcome the raccoons this time? Mike's problem could be the very solution he needs to defeat the tenacious raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: In The Doghouse. Mike is forced to spend the day outside in his doghouse due to Grandma Mikkelsen's fur allergy. Mike makes the best of being exiled and plans to spruce the place up and invite Iris over for an outdoor picnic. But Mercury has been kicked out of his lair after a fight with his brother and decides to squat in the doghouse. Mike does everything he can to wake up the snoozing raccoon and get him out of his home. It looks like he's going to have to bring in the big guns if has any chance of evicting his unwanted guest before Iris shows up.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Roadworks. Mr. Bean’s tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Sofa. Mr. Bean likes nothing more than to relax on his sofa with a good meal and his favourite telly programme. Unfortunately, a painful explosion of springs under his bottom puts an end to that. He sets about buying another one… but, alas, sofas are expensive items. TV dinners may well be a thing of the past for Mr Bean.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Treasure! In a dark and cobwebby corner of his attic, Mr. Bean finds a treasure map. The hunt is on! But tricky clues lead Bean up the chimney, round the bend, down the garden path, up the blinking wall and nearly all the way to Australia.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Homeless. After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Change. The bugs talk about how they feel when things change.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Favourite Things. The bugs talk about some of their favourite things.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Maggie 2.0. When a botched update causes Maggie to reboot as “Magz”, a super fun party animal, Ella, Slippy and Madhu are excited! At least until “Magz” excessive ways put them all in danger! Now, our gang have to figure out how to get Maggie 1.0 back, pronto!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Interstellar Message. When a probe arrives from Madhu’s sibling, our gang sets off to find something amazingly special to send back! But despite their incredible adventure to obtain some super cool moon water - Madhu realizes the most special “thing” they have isn’t a thing at all...

programme.sub-title: I’ll Be Your Shelter. A musical tribute to Ace, the super-brave bat-hound!

They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.sub-title: Camelot Cat. Tom and Jerry save King Arthur's kingdom from and evil sorcerer, Morgan.
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Change. The bugs talk about how they feel when things change.

programme.sub-title: Millenium Mouse. An ancient flying machine is discovered in Postlewaite Manor.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.sub-title: Grumpelstiltskin. A oompah land retelling of the Rumpelstiltskin story.
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Favourite Things. The bugs talk about some of their favourite things.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Inventor. When Mr. Wicket gets a new lodger who is an Inventor, and a big nuisance, Bean discovers that he has to become ‘inventive’ himself. But, when your enemy is clever and sneaky, you have to be even cleverer and sneakier. Bean has never lost ‘a cleverness competition’, but maybe there is a first time for everything!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Car Trouble. Conned by a mechanic into believing his beloved car to be beyond repair, Mr. Bean reluctantly consigns his faithful four-wheeled friend to the car crusher. After choosing hot-air ballooning as an alternative mode of transport, he spots his cherished car from the air… with the unscrupulous mechanic whistling at the wheel! This discovery raises more than Mr. Bean’s spirits.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Restaurant. Mr. Bean’s Birthday dinner gets off on the wrong foot when he and Teddy are made to take the worst table at a swanky restaurant. The evening is further ruined by a self-obsessed movie star at the next table. After a swim in the lobster tank, Mr. Bean unwittingly cooks up sweet revenge in the kitchen.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Art thief. During a visit to London's National Gallery, Bean witnesses the theft of a major work of art. Bloodhound that he is, he pursues the culprit across the Channel to Paris only to be waylaid by a Reliant Robin, a traffic jam, and a mime artist under the Eiffel Tower. Will Mr Bean ‘the International Art Sleuth’ prove successful?

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.sub-title: Hide N' Seek. The crew plays Hide N’ Seek at headquarters and Tweety is the seeker.
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Crystal Cavern
programme.desc: Crystal Cavern

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Space Oddity. When a prized possession goes missing, Slippy’s sure the mysterious Alien Silicon Jellyfish took it! Ella’s pretty sure the Jellyfish doesn’t exist... but as the gang hunts for it, Ella learns that supporting her friend is what matters most!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Runaway Rover. On the eve of Dad opening his museum of human artifacts on the moon, Ella and Slippy help him by “fixing” a lunar rover until it drives off, with Glitch on board! Determined to fix this themselves, our gang understands it’s best to admit your mistake and ask for help.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Home Away from Home. Tom falls asleep inside a rolled-up carpet left out on the curb by Rick with a "free" sign attached. When the new owners unload their pickup truck and leave the carpet in front of their home, a sleepy Tom doesn't notice at first that everything is similar to, but a little different than, his usual surroundings. Soon Tom feels that he's landed in bizarro world.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: From Riches to Rags. After a series of beatings from Tom, Jerry storms off into his mouse hole. Soon he falls asleep and dreams himself to be the Lord of Downton Abbey! Tom is now servant to Lord Jerry, and the Master wastes no time in making Tom's life miserable. Tom is caught in the act of exacting revenge, so Lord Jerry challenges Tom to a duel in the dream world.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Chew Toy. Tom is watching a hypnotist on TV, when the words "you are asleep" hit him hard. He becomes a virtual rag doll and ends up in a jumble of junk for Rick and Ginger's yard sale. A woman who thinks he's a stuffed animal buys him. Jerry feels bad and hops aboard the car to rescue Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Live and Let Diet. The Lady of the Manor's prize Pomeranian, Alfred, must get some pounds off before the big dog show. The butler suggests exercise—chasing a cat perhaps? Tom happily obliges, as Alfred's successful weight loss guarantees him a cushy spot upstairs. Meanwhile, Jerry aims to sabotage Tom's efforts.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Auntie Social. When Rick and Ginger go to a couple's retreat, they leave Tom with Rick's Auntie Louella. Hearing that she's a whiz in the kitchen, Jerry comes along. The old woman is sweet, but she has a nasty little lap dog that bedevils Tom like crazy. Louella keeps treating Tom poorly, and Tom and Jerry make their plans to escape.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings II
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Palladium Quest. When a friendly game accidentally breaks Maggie, Ella and co set out to find a rare metal to help fix her. But it’s a metal so rare it’s only in asteroids! After a few unsuccessful attempts, they realize the knowledge Maggie gave them before she broke could help save the day!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Friendship Supernova. Slippy wants to watch an eclipse so badly that he makes special safety goggles for himself and his friends. But Ella has a different plan. When she insists on going to watch a binary star supernova, Slippy opts out and heads off on his own.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.sub-title: Doctor Check Up Song. The doctor is going to check to see that we’re healthy today!
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Gadget Kid. Mr. Bean finds himself dogged by a young Japanese boy at the Science Museum. He takes an instant dislike to the Scallywag until he sees what the kid has in his backpack: gadgets so cool you can’t even get them in the West. So when a security guard tries to ruin their fun they run away together to... Mars!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: The Visitor. Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. By this time his new ‘friend’ has put his feet up and is eating Bean out of house and home. This blast from the past proves to be a blasted pain in the neck.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: The Big TV. Irma Gobb comes round to watch TV and Bean finds that liking different programmes to your girlfriend can be very bad for a relationship. After an explosive argument the TV blows up, forcing Mr. Bean to invent his own very ingenious form of home entertainment.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Keyboard Capers. Determined to master Beethoven’s symphony, Mr Bean wangles himself a grand piano, a music book, a candelabra and a very patient piano teacher. Liberace, eat your heart out!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Hay, Now!
programme.desc: Hay, Now!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings II
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Sleeping King. When the Queen reluctantly takes Charlie to Frostaland so he can take part in the traditional “Cherry-Choc Harvest,” she finds the King fast asleep, due to a blunder committed by Alice. But instead of helping Alice and Lewis find an antidote to break the magic spell he’s under, the monarch throws every monkey wrench she can possibly get her hands on into the works! Truth is: she’s jealous of Charlie’s affection for the King of Frostaland.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Lewis' Shadow. Lewis’ shadow becomes detached when Alice accidentally shuts the door behind her rabbit friend a little too fast! Alice finds it super funny. Lewis, on the other hand, is freaking out: his shadow’s a bit too facetious for his liking, not to mention the fact that Queen has a rule against shadows coming off! Unfortunately, the shadow has a mind of its own and the monarch soon finds out. When Alice and Lewis get grounded because of it, the rabbit blames his shadow. But when the latter comes to their rescue, he realizes he misjudged it. In fact, he actually grows pretty fond of it in the end!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Teatime on the Moon. Following a mess-up by Alice, the Queen shamelessly decides to hold her teatime ritual on the Moon, without asking its permission. During this “incursion,” Alice & Lewis do all they can to keep the satellite and its odd inhabitants (Moon-Cutie-Twees, who clean the moon all year round) from being disturbed. But unfortunately, the Queen gets it into her head to build a “vacation home” on the Moon! There’s only one way to get her out of there: her castle must be invaded!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: A Joker for a Queen. Jojo, one of the King of Frostaland’s joker cards, looks on in awe as Queen skillfully guides her procession of cards with a snap of her fingers! When the King responds with his own parade, however, he lets his cards do whatever they please, leaving poor Jojo clueless. This prompts her to decide to leave Frostaland and head off to train in Wonderland, to be part of the Queen’s parade. Noticing how sad the King is to see his joker card go, Alice and Lewis do everything they can to persuade Jojo to return. But in so doing, they too find themselves enrolled alongside the Queen’s cards!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Magical Mandolin. When Wicked Witch Wilhelmina (JESSICA DiCICCO) steals the Magical Mandolin ("Play it by day, it makes you dance; but play it at night, it puts you in a trance!"), Dorothy and her friends have to get it back…and fast! Or Wilhelmina will use the Mandolin to put Dorothy in a trance and steal her Ruby Slippers! Dorothy has to rely on her friends and the power of her Ruby Slippers to get it back or Wilhelmina will have her, and all of Oz, dancing to a new tune.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Official Ozian Exam. The Mayor tells Dorothy she must pass the Official Oziam Exam in order to stay in Oz. Scarecrow (MICHAEL GOUGH) tries to tutor her, but an emergency in Munchkinland takes her attention off the books and onto an adventure. She has to save Munchkinland from a terrible dragon who has taken refuge on the Sapphire City. Is Dorothy is able to help and have time to study? How will she pass the test?

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Locket Locket in My Pocket. The Munchkins are throwing a down-home, country fair in honor of Dorothy. While Dorothy enjoys the pleasures of the fair, Wilhelmina finds a magical locket that allows her to look exactly like whoever's picture she keeps in it (except for a green streak in her hair). Wilhelmina uses it to take the form of Dorothy and crash the fair. With the wicked Dorothy impersonator running about the fair, the Munchkins are appalled that Princess Dorothy is acting so greedy, grabby and ungrateful! The real Princess Dorothy must figure out what's going on and clear her name before the citizens of Oz revoke her Princess-ship.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Mixed-Up Mixer. Ozma wants to whip up a snack but has never baked before. Dorothy shows her how to make cookies. But Dorothy accidentally grabs the Potion of Life instead of the vanilla and pours it into the mixing bowl! The hand-mixer spins to life, magically mixing things together as it whizzes around the room. Oh my! The mixer spins out of the palace, mixing everything in its path! Realizing the only way to reverse the mix-up is to reverse the spell, Dorothy and Ozma must use the mirror to change the Potion of Life into the Liquid of Petrification.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Ojo the Unlucky. Dorothy and the gang need to take a munchkin Ojo the Unlucky to the Land of Ev to reverse his curse! As soon as they start their journey, they find out how Ojo the Unlucky earned his name – when they are plagued with the worst bad luck they've ever seen! From having to cross the Deadly Desert to getting attacked by Orks, it's bad luck at every turn. When the Nome King catches them, he's determined to lock them up to keep the bad luck out of his kingdom. But Dorothy reframes their day, realizing it was actually Ojo's good luck that got them out of every obstacle.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Rules of Attraction. It's Valentine's Day and Dorothy wants to teach the Ozians all about this tradition. Ozma gives her new BFF the perfect Valentine's present – a love magnet! However, the magnet magically makes everyone fall in love with Dorothy. It becomes mayhem when the gift giving and "acts" of love overwhelm Dorothy. Could there be such a thing as too much love?

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Double Teatime in Wonderland. Jealous of the King of Frostaland, who is celebrating Alice’s “non-birthday,” the Queen organizes a double-teatime at the castle and forces all her subjects to attend. Alice and Lewis try to enjoy both celebrations. But there’s no denying it: it’s way more chill at the King’s party than the Queen’s, where the poor guests are subjected to fear and intimidation! In fact, it’s so bad that before long, the Queen’s guests start defecting, migrating to the more fun venue in Frostaland. Alice and Lewis try to avoid a crisis by making sure the Queen doesn’t find out they’re having fun behind her back…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Dodson's Predictions. In order to escape punishment, Dodson kids the Queen into believing he is able to read the future. Falling for his story, Queen names him “Great Fortune-Telling Dodo” and invites him to live in the castle. Dodson milks it, using his influence over the monarch to fulfill all his desires, even if it means relieving poor Lewis of his clockmaster duties! Luckily, Alice runs to her rabbit friend’s rescue. But how are they going to prove to the Queen that Dodson doesn’t actually have a single power and that he’s merely using her for his own benefit?!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The "Werewolf Cactus". Lewis gets a shock when he wakes up one morning and sees all his carrots have been gobbled up overnight! To get to the bottom of it, Alice and Lewis call on the Police Card. Our two heroes accuse Dodson right off the bat: he seems to be the perfect suspect! But then discover the true culprit: a cactus that transforms into a “werewolf cactus” when night falls! And Alice and Lewis are in for a big surprise when they find out who is behind this famished creature!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Spirit of Adventure. Lewis is at the end of his rope: the Twins have set up home in his yard and have left the Cutie-Twees to their own devices, letting them wreak havoc in the poor rabbit’s house! Alice devises a stratagem to restore Twee Di and Twee Dum’s taste for adventure and travel. But little does she know they’re still recovering from their last expedition, which went seriously south!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: An Imaginary Injury. While Lewis prepares for the arrival of the Carrot-Grow Cloud (which will triple his carrot harvest), the King almost runs into him with his chariot! Luckily, the rabbit suffered more fear than pain, but the monarch is convinced he was badly affected by this accident! Wanting to do the right thing, he forces Lewis to rest and goes about pampering him. Our rabbit friend doesn’t dare contradict him. But the Carrot-Grow-Cloud is approaching, and, at this rate, the King is going to spoil everything! Alice decides to help her friend accomplish his harvesting mission and say ‘No’ to the King, without offending him…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Ditzy Home. Stephan upgrades the house's security system and it looks like Mike might be able to take a break from playing guard dog. The new system immediately detects when the raccoons are trying to break in and ejects from the property. Mike didn't even have to lift a paw. Unfortunately, the system works a little too well and quickly targets Mike as an intruder too. Now Mike and Freddy are on the same team trying to break in so he can defeat the errant security system and save Mercury and Fluffy who are still trapped inside.

programme.sub-title: Kung Fu Lemmings. The Lemmings draw inspiration from lessons they find in a
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Artful Bean. There’s easy money to be had in the art world and Mr. Bean is set on getting some of it. Once equipped with the right tools, he ventures into the countryside with a blank canvas in search of inspiration – and comes home with a painting full of life. Literally.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: The Fly. When Mr. Bean finds a fly in his room, it's war. He needs weapons. Fly spray? A rolled-up magazine? These are only the start. In desperation, he enlists a mouldy doughnut, an encyclopaedia, an upside-down dustbin and a club-hammer. Finally, Bean becomes the first man in history to wage war on a fly... with a fridge.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Mime Games. A leisurely stroll in the park turns into a run when Mr. Bean is chased home by an angry Mime Artist. He is lost for more words than usual when the street performer makes himself at home and insists on being wined and dined. Bean ousts the pest from his house using the only language mime artists understand.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Spring Clean. It's the First Day of Spring and Mr. Bean sets about washing his clothes, his furniture, his teddy and himself. But, alas, there’s no hot water! A bit of inventive improvisation with an outside drainpipe proves Mr. Bean to be greener at D.I.Y. plumbing than he thought.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Toad & Friends
programme.desc: ‘Toad and Friends’, based on Kenneth Grahame’s literary classic, ‘The Wind in The Willows’, is lovingly brought to life in a brand-new animated series for 4-7 year olds in which Mole, Ratty and Toad are joined by Hedge, a young hedgehog with a zest for life.

programme.title: Toad & Friends

programme.sub-title: Talking About Trying. The bugs talk about trying new things.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Sadness. The bugs talk about feeling sad.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Interstellar Treasure Hunter. Dad gives Ella and Slippy a mysterious Treasure Map of their solar system. When Ella cuts corners as soon as she realizes where the final step is! But when that doesn’t yield them the treasure, she must learn to follow instructions. All of them...

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Speed of Ella. Ella’s super excited to check out the Orion flare stars with her family. She’s been looking forward to it for weeks. But when Madhu asks a favour and Slippy calls her for help, Ella can’t say no and might miss the festival entirely! Can she use science to get there in time?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Neighbourly Bean. As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Nurse! Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to 'break' his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesn't enjoy.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Dead Cat. Whilst trying to redecorate the hall, Bean is obstructed at every turn by his landlady’s vile one-eyed cat. Bean pops it in the dustbin to keep it out of the way for a while. Just his luck that it’s rubbish collection day.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Supertrolley. Nipping to the shops for a few provisions becomes a nightmare when a mile-long shopping list from his landlady and a clapped out trolley with a wonky wheel conspire to ruin his day. Subscribing to the theory that bigger is better, he constructs his own shopping trolley incorporating a petrol mower, pram wheels and an extra pair of hydraulic hands.

programme.sub-title: Kana and the Butterflies
programme.desc: Kana and the Butterflies

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Glitch's Big Day. When Glitch’s arm shorts out, Ella’s dad has the right tools to fix him. While he’s at it, Dad shows off his latest creation, a Super Towing Arm. Slippy is impressed and Glitch is more than happy to try it on for size

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Interstellar Pet Sitter. Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friend’s dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldn’t have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Brain Food. Waffles is worried that his roommate Bo had his brain eaten by aliens, leaving him a zombie dog. Turns out he's not the first dog in his neighborhood to wake up stupid. Afraid of becoming the next Bo, Waffles hires the Cat and Mouse Detectives to put a stop to this alien invasion. Our Narrator thinks all of this extraterrestrial talk is a load of sci-fi hooey but not our detectives; they're covering all their bases and taking every necessary precaution. Turns out the dog's behavior has more to do with a tainted bag of kibble than visitors from another planet… or does it?

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Cold Snap. Wanting to cool off from the blistering heat, Tom and Jerry use a little magic to make it snow, turning the witches' world into a haunted winter wonderland with an evil snowman, haunted snow forts and magic snowball fights. Now they have to figure out how to make it stop snowing.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: The Tortoise Don't Play Fair. When a Hare loses to a Tortoise in the biggest race of the year, he comes to Tom and Jerry claiming foul play. It's up to the duo to see what's really behind the most famous race in history.

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Wish Bone. Butch finds a wish bone in the garbage and dupes Tom into believing that it will make his wishes come true. Butch trades Tom the bone for a dozen cans of cat food. The alley cat thinks he's pulled off the best scam ever UNTIL Tom's wishes start coming true (from Jerry getting his just dessert to Toodles paying an unexpected visit)! Now Butch will stop at nothing to get that bone back!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Novel Idea. An overflowing trash bin filled with crumpled paper can mean only one thing…Tom is writing a novel - it's a mystery novel, of course! Tom soon realizes his book is playing out in real life (including the femme fatale who has taken an interest in the feline Mikey Spillane). At first, Tom has fun crafting his own fate, but soon realizes no matter how hard he tries to rewrite his story, he gets deeper and deeper into trouble. Jerry begins to suspect the alley cat, Butch, is up to no good – in the end, Jerry figures out Butch was retrieving Tom's discarded writing from the trash and using it to his advantage!

programme.title: The Tom and...
programme.desc: Cat Match Fever. Butch is bobbing for apple cores when he spots a dolled up Toodles heading his way! Butch slicks back his hair with some lard and strikes a pose. But she walks right past the alley cat. Meanwhile, inside the house, Tom spots Toodles headed in his direction. After a quick spruce up, Tom opens the door only to watch her walk right past the house. Tom slumps. Turns out Toodles is headed to Winston's house. Yep, who knew the two were a match made in kitty heaven (or at least that's what the catmatch app said). Tom and Butch both set out to win Toodles affection while Jerry plays Cyrano to Winston to help him get over his nerves.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Constellation Prize. Slippy’s attempts to impress his cousins with constellation drawings goes awry, causing them to get lost in a nebula! As the nebula messes with their racers and gadgets, escape becomes hopeless. It’s up to Ella and Madhu to find a way to guide them safely back home!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Space Junk. When Space Junk smashes into their clubhouse, Ella and Slippy set off to fix the problem. While Ella wants to be rid of the junk, Slippy’s determined to reuse or at least recycle it. When Ella is trapped, re-using space junk may be the only way to save her!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Goldfish. With his teddy bear at the dry cleaners, Mr. Bean finds himself feeling lonely. Fortunately, a new playmate appears in the shape of a goldfish from the garden pond. Bean has a great time with his new best friend until, at the seaside, he discovers that some fish are gigantic, have large pointed teeth and fins on their backs.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Inventor. When Mr. Wicket gets a new lodger who is an Inventor, and a big nuisance, Bean discovers that he has to become ‘inventive’ himself. But, when your enemy is clever and sneaky, you have to be even cleverer and sneakier. Bean has never lost ‘a cleverness competition’, but maybe there is a first time for everything!

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Car Trouble. Conned by a mechanic into believing his beloved car to be beyond repair, Mr. Bean reluctantly consigns his faithful four-wheeled friend to the car crusher. After choosing hot-air ballooning as an alternative mode of transport, he spots his cherished car from the air… with the unscrupulous mechanic whistling at the wheel! This discovery raises more than Mr. Bean’s spirits.

programme.title: The Mr. Bean...
programme.desc: Restaurant. Mr. Bean’s Birthday dinner gets off on the wrong foot when he and Teddy are made to take the worst table at a swanky restaurant. The evening is further ruined by a self-obsessed movie star at the next table. After a swim in the lobster tank, Mr. Bean unwittingly cooks up sweet revenge in the kitchen.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice loves going to Wonderland and teaming up with Lewis and her other friends, even if it means contending with the whimsical, hot-headed Queen. Each episode entails a visit to Wonderland, where Alice experiences a wacky adventure with Lewis, confronting the crazy, eccentric rules and conventions that reign supreme in this parallel Kingdom. Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: DOROTHY AND THE WIZARD OF OZ is an animated comedy fantasy series that transports viewers back to the wonderful land of Oz. Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale (GREY DeLISLE) has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: DOROTHY AND THE WIZARD OF OZ is an animated comedy fantasy series that transports viewers back to the wonderful land of Oz. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Blinkie Gets Her Groove Back. On the way to Ozma's weekly picnic, Dorothy and friends come upon Blinkie, a cranky old former witch who lost her powers long ago. To everyone's dismay, Dorothy invites Blinkie along. But she ends up loving it! Blinkie is overjoyed at the fun and friendship and is invited back the next week. The Wicked Witch gets a whiff of this and can't believe it! She lost her powers once and she didn't hang out with those goody-goodies. Maybe Blinkie needs help remembering her wicked roots, and her powers back. And the Wicked Witch has found a way to do it so Blinkie betrays her new friends in the process.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Who's The Boss. Tom walks in and catches Mercury trying to break into in the garage. He thinks Mercury would make the cool, exciting pet he's always wanted. To Mike's horror, Tom makes him promise to make sure nothing happens to Mercury while he's at school. Mike, ever the obedient pooch, does his best but the turtles want Mercury out of the house. Mercury is making himself way too comfortable. Mike will need to use all his brainpower to kick the unwanted guest out of the house and enlists Freddy as an unlikely ally.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Trojan Racoons. The raccoons find a brilliant way of getting into the Mikkelsen's house without anyone noticing by getting mailed to the house inside in a cardboard box. Mike falls for it and the raccoons are free to steal whatever they want in their few minutes of freedom inside the house. The racoons skedaddle back to their lair, but instead of stealing the loot, Mercury brings back an old grandfather clock that belonged to the family's grandmother. Now Mike has to break into the raccoon's lair, retrieve the family heirloom and give the raccoons a taste of their own medicine.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: DOROTHY AND THE WIZARD OF OZ is an animated comedy fantasy series that transports viewers back to the wonderful land of Oz. Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale (GREY DeLISLE) has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Guardians of the Gates of Yawn. The Wicked Witch follows a clue on the silver slippers to Emerald City Clock Tower, putting all the guards in her way to sleep with a very powerful potion. But she gets more than she bargained for when she accidentally sets off every single alarm clock in the whole place and awakens the Quox, a giant silver beast slumbering beneath Emerald City! While Dorothy and friends are preoccupied with trying to deal with that thing, the witches dive deep into the tunnel the Quox came from for signs of the silver slippers. Dorothy and friends figure out the only way to deal with the beast is to put it back to sleep. And the only way to do it is by stealing the Wicked Witch's sleeping potion!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: Trip to the Moon. When a meteor comes crashing to Oz, Dorothy and the gang discover that it contains a clue that could lead them to the location of the silver slippers, all the way up on the moon! Enlisting the help of Smith and Tinker, the guys build a space ship that sends them right to the moon. But the Wicked Witch and Wilhelmina are right on their tail with a rocket ship of their own. Dorothy and friends land on the moon and with the help of the moon's residents, the Moonies, they find the clue that may finally lead them to the silver slippers' location. But the Wicked Witch is determined to get it first.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz III
programme.desc: DOROTHY AND THE WIZARD OF OZ is an animated comedy fantasy series that transports viewers back to the wonderful land of Oz. Following the defeat of the Wicked Witch of the West, Dorothy Gale (GREY DeLISLE) has been appointed Princess of Emerald City by Queen Ozma. Faced with obstacles at every turn – from flying monkeys to her arch nemesis, Wilhelmina (the Wicked Witch of the West's niece and protégé) – Dorothy bravely tackles her royal duties with her feet firmly planted in her magical ruby slippers.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice loves going to Wonderland and teaming up with Lewis and her other friends, even if it means contending with the whimsical, hot-headed Queen. Each episode entails a visit to Wonderland, where Alice experiences a wacky adventure with Lewis, confronting the crazy, eccentric rules and conventions that reign supreme in this parallel Kingdom. Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Day Star. It’s the Night of the Stars in Wonderland and Lewis invites Alice to see the show. Afterwards, our two friends make an unexpected encounter in the garden: they find a little star that’s eager to see daytime! Alice is only too happy to help it fulfill its dream. But when it starts gradually losing its star dust, they realize there’s a risk it might not be able to rise back into the sky to shine once again alongside its relatives. Alice and Lewis must prevent that danger from occurring, ASAP! And so off they head to the Valley of the Night!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Tooth the Rescue! When one of Lewis’ teeth falls out, no little tooth fairy comes to see him. Instead, the whole of Wonderland converges upon him! Basically, in this world, a loose tooth is an opportunity for making a wish, which makes it a very sought-after commodity among the Wonderlanders!! In the midst of all this squabbling, Alice must use cunning to help her good friend Lewis hold onto his precious tooth!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Journey to the Moon. While delivering a yummy stew to the Queen, Alice and Lewis notice the moon is crying and that its falling tears are flooding the castle! Afraid her royal residence is about to collapse any minute, Queen orders Alice and Lewis to find a solution to this problem on the double! And so off they go to the moon, where a whole plethora of surprises awaits them.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.desc: Juninho. Jeden z brazilských kouzelníků a jeden z hlavních strůjců úspěchu Kanárků na MS v Japonsku a Koreji v roce 2002. Drobnému útočníkovi jen málokdo předpovídal úspěch mezi profesionály, přesto se v nabité konkurenci dokázal prosadit. Na britských ostrovech našel svůj nový domov - v Middlesbrough.

programme.title: CANAL+ Sport - přestávka ve vysílání
programme.sub-title: Přestávka ve vysílání.
programme.desc: Přestávka ve vysílání.

programme.title: Noe
programme.desc: Drama USA (2014). Držitel Oscara Russell Crowe se představí coby Noe, muž vyvolený Bohem, jenž musí svůj úkol vyplnit dříve, než svět smete apokalyptická potopa.

programme.title: Koroner (3)
programme.desc: Seriál Kan. (2019). Jenny vyšetřuje rozčtvrcené tělo, které je nalezeno v Crotherově lese. Ross se potýká se smrtí svého otce.

programme.title: Koroner (4)
programme.desc: Seriál Kan. (2019). Jenny se vydává pronásledovat vraha, který po sobě zanechává krvavou stopu po celém městě. Vše se ještě víc zdramatizuje, když zjistí, že její syn s ním byl v kontaktu.

programme.title: Kung fu Yoga
programme.desc: Komedie Čína/Indie (2017). Dva profesoři se spojí, aby našli ztracený poklad, a podniknou dobrodružství, které je zavede do tibetské ledové jeskyně, do Dubaje i do horského chrámu v Indii.

programme.title: 47 róninů
programme.desc: Akční dobrodružný film USA (2013). Rónin je samuraj, který ztratil svého pána a tím i svou čest, a jeho postavení na společenském žebříčku středověkého Japonska tomu odpovídá. Ještě mnohem níž však stojí lidé smíšené rasy, mezi něž patří i nalezenec Kai (Keanu Reeves), zčásti Brit, zčásti Japonec. Díky svým mimořádným schopnostem je vzat na milost skupinou bývalých samurajů, jejichž pán se stal obětí spiknutí, které připravili zákeřný Lord Kira a čarodějka Mizuki. Róninové chtějí Lorda Kiru porazit za každou cenu, jenže trumfy rozhodně nejsou na jejich straně. Dokud nezískají Kaie. I tak ale bude cesta za spravedlivou odplatou trnitá a jen málokdo z nich po ní dojde až do konce, který navíc může mít v souladu s japonskými tradicemi velmi trpkou příchuť.

programme.title: Bournův mýtus
programme.desc: Thriller N/USA (2004). Jason Bourne, bývalý zabiják CIA trpící ztrátou paměti, se domnívá, že se mu podařilo utéct před vlastní minulostí a se svou přítelkyní Marií si užívají klidu v jejich dočasném domově v zapadlé indické vesnici. Ale i tam jsou vystopováni. Jason s Marií místo kvapně opouštějí. Mezitím byli v Berlíně zavražděni dva agenti CIA a vše nasvědčuje tomu, že je zabil právě Bourne. Znovu se tak kolem něj začne stahovat smrtící smyčka a Jason se opět vydává na cestu. Je odhodlán vypátrat strůjce falešného obvinění a přitom postupně objevuje i svou ztracenou minulost.

programme.title: Konferenční přenos
programme.desc: VB (2023). Až šest zápasů anglické Premier League najednou. Moderovaný přímý přenos s důrazem na góly a nejzajímavější momenty duelů.

programme.title: Rumový deník
programme.desc: Životopisné drama USA (2010). Na sklonku padesátých let minulého století se jeden neúspěšný spisovatel začne živit psaním pro skomírající plátek v Portoriku. Zde také spadne po hlavě do problémů s alkoholem, nekalými praktikami točícími se kolem místního územního rozvoje a vztahu s krásnou, ale zadanou ženou.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Poslední výstřel
programme.desc: Thriller USA (2011). V Pennsylvanii dojde ke střelbě do lidí z nedalekého parkovacího domu. Výsledkem je pět nevinných obětí, které nemají nic společného. Případ vyšetřuje detektiv Emerson, který podle otisku prstu na minci, vhozené do parkovacího automatu, odhalí střelce. Je jím bývalý vojenský sniper James Barr, který byl již v minulosti vyšetřován pro vraždu lidí na misi v Iráku.

programme.title: Konferenční přenos
programme.desc: VB (2023). Až šest zápasů anglické Premier League najednou. Moderovaný přímý přenos s důrazem na góly a nejzajímavější momenty duelů.

programme.title: Klangor (3)
programme.desc: Dramatický seriál Pol. (2020). Emil je dopaden a přiveden zpět do nemocnice. Policie se snaží zjistit, kdo zabil Gabiina přítele Ariela. Magda naléhá na Rafała, aby informoval policii o jejich zmizelé dceři. Emil veškerá obvinění popírá a tvrdí, že s tím, co se té noci stalo mladým, nemá nic společného.

programme.title: Klangor (4)
programme.desc: Dramatický seriál Pol. (2020). Policie najde na jedné ze starých bárek v přístavu alkohol, drogy, Gabiino oblečení a spoustu krve. Rafał popírá policejní teorii naznačující, že jeho dcera spáchala sebevraždu. Policie a skupina dobrovolníků začnou Gabi hledat v okolí útesů, kde se naposledy přihlásil její telefon.
